Jean-Laurent Rosenthal & R. Bin Wong, Before and Beyond Divergence: The Politics of Economic Change in China and Europe, Harvard University Press, 2011。周琳：“加州学派中国经济史研究述评”，《清华大学学报》，2009年第1期。

1、让同学们了解自2000年以来国内外学界在“中国经济近代转型”问题上的重要著作、观点、学派和足以改变学术研究潮流的理论论战。
2、带同学了解新制度经济学、政治学的一些杰出研究者（如Douglass C. North, Charles Tilly等）和他们的代表性论著，作为审视中欧制度变迁的必要基础。
3、介绍王国斌教授以政治视角切入社会经济史研究的学术关怀，以及“政治经济”、“政治规模”、“政治制度差异”等关键概念。
4、从中欧比较的视角，回顾中国制度史对于经济、社会变迁的意义。

本门课程主讲人为美国加州大学洛杉矶分校亚洲研究中心主任王国斌(R. Bin Wong)，课程内容主要来自王国斌教授极具影响力的著作《Before and Beyond Divergence: The Politics of Economic Change in China and Europe》。该课程一方面接续国内外学界十余年来对于中欧经济“大分流”的探讨，带领同学回顾几十年来海外汉学研究和中国社会经济史研究的学术史，另一方面从“政治经济”和中欧比较的视角，给“大分流”以全新的解释。阐释在“大分流”发生前几个世纪之中，中国和欧洲经济变迁背后的政治逻辑，展现“政治制度”和“国家规模”在中国和欧洲经济近代化进程中的决定性影响。

This course will examine the origins of agriculture in a comparative, global perspective. It will lay out the methodological issues surrounding the archaeological identification of plant and animal domestication processes and centres of origins, and then review the current evidence and debates about domestication and the origins of agriculture in various world regions, including Southwest Asia, West and East Africa, India, China, New Guinea, Mexico, Tropical South America, and the Andes, before returning to consider how commonalities and differences across these regions provide insights in the causes of the transition to agriculture

This course will consider the trajectories from in West Asia (Mesopotamia) and South Asia (India and Pakistan) starting from the transition to agriculture following through the rise of social hierarchy, urbanism and states. Key themes to be considered are the processes of (a) increased agricultural production (expansion and/or intensification) that allowed for the food supply of cities, (b) the emergence of specialized production through perennial crops and pastoral products, (c) craft specialization and new crafts, including the emergence of metallurgy, and (d) evidence of long distance trade. Each of these 4 themes (a-d) will be considered in the context of (i) Greater Mesopotamia, (ii) The Indus Valley), (iii) the Ganges Plains, and (iv) The Deccan Plateau of south India

Archaeological research is moving at an increasingly rapid pace, with advances in archaeological methods and theory propelling new interpretations and understandings of archaeological findings. This course we will focus on contemporary developments in archaeology, with an emphasis on current trends in theory, method, and discovery. The objectives of the course are to place emerging trends in archaeological research in a historical context, to understand new methods, and to explore how various theoretical approaches influence the conduct of archaeological research around the globe. The course will be constructed around a series of topics decided on by the class in the first session. The instructor will assign readings for the first week to serve as a jumping off point for class discussion and will provide a list of possible topics for consideration. Class investment in topics of concern is an important consideration. Students are expected to identify and share readings for weekly topics, and to lead discussions as well as participate in the conversation about a given topic or reading. Because the course is about novel research we will spend our time exploring the most current literature and considering how recent findings affect interpretations of local, regional, and global archaeological evidence

This programme takes several approaches to American Revolution, offering an overview of the major topics, issues, and debates associated with American Revolution and its antecedents, using prominent works to help you to understand it then to consider and assess methodologies though those works. Not only providing a comprehensive survey of the field, it offers the opportunity to discuss and analyze in depth a small number of historiographical landmarks during American Revolution. Gaining an enhanced understanding of some of the main topics, issues, and debates in American Revolution, we will focus on its arguments, its strengths and weaknesses, and its contribution to U.S. history. By participating in oral discussions, students should develop critical awareness of American Revolution and an understanding of the connections between historical argument, methodology, and sources. This programme will enable students to combine these acknowledge they have acquired to build a research project

1.文物保存环境监测：针对温度、湿度、有机挥发物（VOC）、光照度、紫外线以及有机污染物等基本环境和污染物指标，配置监测终端；建设环境监测平台，存储和处理监测数据，做好风险识别、预测、预警和评价。2.文物保存环境调控：温度、湿度、污染物等主动调控设备，调湿剂、吸附剂等被动调控材料，博物馆展厅及库房的照明设施。3.文物保存设施：符合安全要求的夹层玻璃展柜、文物储藏柜架、专用囊匣。4.博物馆防震减震：对重点文物保存设施进行防震减震改造，配置防震展具、柜架等保存设施。

田野考古数字化技术课程，首先介绍《考古数字化方案及田野考古信息系统》，了解目前数字化软、硬件在田野考古中的应用现状、发展趋势。其次介绍《测绘基本理论及在考古领域应用》，让学生熟悉基本的测绘理论和测绘设备在考古工作中的应用。再次，通过《摄影测量技术原理及在考古领域应用》讲座，让学生了解摄影测量技术和该技术在考古工作中的运用范围。最后通过《考古绘图软件介绍及数字考古制图》，让学生熟悉考古绘图软件并利用软件进行数字考古制图的方法。z

开设本课程，旨在通过理论教学与实际应用训练，与专业课程互为补充，深入学生对旅游地理学的理解认识；使学生掌握旅游地理学的基础理论知识；塑造和培养学生旅游地理学研究的空间思维。同时结合国际旅游相关研究，使学生了解目前国际旅游的最新动向；开阔学生在旅游认知及学科研究方面的视野；夯实学生的理论知识并进一步拓宽思维，为后续课程学习、科研训练及实践应用奠定基础。

1. 旅游地理学研究课程具体包括旅游地学研究的空间思维（席建超）和国际旅游研究（蒋依依）两个方面的内容。
2. 旅游地学研究的空间思维课程内容主要包括旅游地学的研究对象和研究内容、旅游地学的发展历史及国内外研究趋势等基础内容，以及空间思维培养和训练等相关内容。课程拟从基础理论知识引入，在此基础上结合案例分析及实践训练，以实现全面深入地展现旅游地学研究的空间思维的目的。
3. 国际旅游研究课程内容主要包括重点国家旅游发展现状、“一带一路”沿线国家旅游发展现状，以及国际旅游合作现状和案例研究分析，从多维度、跨学科的角度展现国际旅游研究风貌。
